resources.string: First-Time Launch

As this is the first time you have used the app, would you like each page to present you with a quick guide on how to use it? These guides will not display in landscape mode. \n \nIf you choose no now, you can always reset this decision later at the bottom of the Settings page.
Diabetes Control
This app allows you to input data regarding your blood glucose level readings and your insulin intake without over-complicating the whole process.
Settings
Before you start entering your data, you might want to tweak the settings to tailor the app to your needs.
Exporting

In the future, you may wish to print your data or send it to your GP. To do this, you have a choice of multiple different layouts that you can use to export your data to PDF. You can even export it to a CSV!
Navigation

To move to any one of the three pages you will spend most of your time in, you can click the buttons highlighted below. Alternatively, swiping horizontally in any blank space will move you back or forward through the pages.
Adding New Entry
Whenever you want to add an entry, simply fill in the details on this page and click the highlighted button.
Auto-populated Data
Some of the fields will be auto-populated with the apps best guess, however you can change them manually for each entry if you want.
Viewing Previous Input

When inputting data, if you want to see what data you put in the last time you had or did something similar. \n \nFor example, if you want to see how much insulin you gave yourself the last time you ate chips, simply add chips to your food eaten list and then click this button.
More Options

All of your data will be displayed here. You can long click the entry or click the more options button to open a menu of possible actions. \n \nThese actions allows you to view all data associated with an entry, edit the entry, or delete the entry altogether.
Graph Control

This graph display your blood glucose readings. You can scroll the graph horizontally to view a different range of data, or you can pinch to zoom in and out of the graph. \n \nClicking a point on the graph will take you to its corresponding entry on the \'View All\' page.
Range Statistics
In horizontal view, the statistics for the given graph range are hidden. Just tab the highlighted area to un-hide them.
